Part of the reason why $250,000 would be a reasonable level for a death benefit is that there's that additional liability exposure.
Under workers' comp, employers are shielded from workplace injury lawsuits.
That's the trade-off for guaranteeing care and benefits for as long as necessary.
Opting out of workers' comp in Texas removes the shield and makes lawsuits possible.
